definition: troops belonging to the enemy's military forces, unsolicited and resisted by the management of the target company ( used of attempts to buy or take control of a business)
details:
noun
- troops belonging to the enemy's military forces
= example: troops belonging to the enemy's military forces
adjective
- unsolicited and resisted by the management of the target company ( used of attempts to buy or take control of a business)
= example: unsolicited and resisted by the management of the target company ( used of attempts to buy or take control of a business)
- not belonging to your own country's forces or those of an ally
= example: not belonging to your own country's forces or those of an ally
- very unfavorable to life or growth
= example: very unfavorable to life or growth
= synonyms: uncongenial, unfriendly
- characterized by enmity or ill will
= example: characterized by enmity or ill will
- impossible to bring into friendly accord
= example: impossible to bring into friendly accord
